source package¶

Submodules¶

source.client module¶

source.client.listen_for_messages()[source]¶

Start a thread to continuously listen for messages from the server.

Returns: None

source.client.receive_message(sock)[source]¶

Receive a message from the provided socket.

Parameters: - sock (socket): The socket from which the message will be received.

Returns: bytes: The received message in bytes.

source.client.send_message(sock, message)[source]¶

Send a message through the provided socket.

Parameters: - sock (socket): The socket through which the message will be sent. - message (str or bytes): The message to be sent. If a string, it will be encoded to bytes.

Returns: None

Bases: QMainWindow

Main application window for the chat application.

Methods: - __init__(self, username, chat_client): Initializes the ChatApp. - init_ui(self): Initializes the user interface. - open_private_chat(self, item): Opens a private chat window.

open_private_chat(item)[source]¶

Opens a private chat window.

Parameters: - item: The item clicked in the user list.

class source.guiclient.ChatWidget(username, users_list_widget, messages_widget, private_messages_widget)[source]¶

Bases: QWidget

Widget for displaying and interacting with the public chat.

Attributes: - message_received: Signal emitted when a message is received. - message_sent: Signal emitted when a message is sent.

Methods: - __init__(self, username, users_list_widget, messages_widget, private_messages_widget): Initializes the ChatWidget. - init_ui(self): Initializes the user interface. - send_message(self): Sends a public message. - display_message(self, sender, content): Displays a public message. - display_private_message(self, sender, content): Displays a private message.

display_message(sender, content)[source]¶

Displays a public message.

Parameters: - sender: The sender of the message. - content: The content of the message.

display_private_message(sender, content)[source]¶

Displays a private message.

Parameters: - sender: The sender of the private message. - content: The content of the private message.

init_ui()[source]¶

Initializes the user interface of the ChatWidget.

message_received¶

pyqtSignal(*types, name: str = …, revision: int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

message_sent¶

pyqtSignal(*types, name: str = …, revision: int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

class source.guiclient.LoginSignupPage[source]¶

Bases: QMainWindow

Login and signup page for the chat client.

Methods: - __init__(self): Initializes the LoginSignupPage. - login_clicked(self): Handles the login button click event. - signup_clicked(self): Handles the signup button click event. - get_input_values(self): Retrieves input values from the UI. - send_login_request(self, username, password): Sends a login request to the server. - send_signup_request(self, username, password): Sends a signup request to the server. - open_chat_app(self): Opens the main chat application window. - show_connection_error(self, error): Displays a connection error message. - show_unexpected_response_error(self): Displays an unexpected server response error message. - open_success_window(self, message): Displays a success message. - open_error_window(self, title, message): Displays an error message. - send_message(self, message): Sends a message to the server. - receive_message(self): Receives a message from the server.

source.server module¶

source.server.admin_console()[source]¶

Run the admin console, allowing the administrator to input commands.

Returns:

None

source.server.authenticate_user(username, password)[source]¶

Authenticate a user with the provided username and password.

Args:

username (str): The username to authenticate. password (str): The password to check.

Returns:

bool: True if authentication is successful, False otherwise.

source.server.ban_user(target_user)[source]¶

Ban a user from the server indefinitely.

Args:

target_user (str): The username of the user to be banned.

Returns:

None

source.server.broadcast_message(sender_username, message)[source]¶

Broadcast a message to all connected clients.

Args:

sender_username (str): The username of the sender. message (str): The message to broadcast.

Returns:

None

source.server.close_database_connection()[source]¶

Close the connection to the database.

Returns:

None

source.server.close_user_socket(username)[source]¶

Close the socket connection for a kicked or banned user.

Args:

username (str): The username of the user whose socket to close.

Returns:

None

source.server.get_user_ip(username)[source]¶

Retrieve the IP address associated with a given username.

Args:

username (str): The username for which to retrieve the IP address.

Returns:

str or None: The IP address of the user, or None if not found.

source.server.get_user_socket(username)[source]¶

Retrieve the socket associated with a given username.

Args:

username (str): The username for which to retrieve the socket.

Returns:

socket.socket or None: The socket of the user, or None if not found.

source.server.handle_client(client_socket, addr)[source]¶

Handles communication with a connected client.

Args:

client_socket (socket.socket): The client’s socket. addr (tuple): The client’s address.

Returns:

None

source.server.handle_login(client_socket)[source]¶

Handle the login process for a client.

Args:

client_socket (socket.socket): The client’s socket.

Returns:

str or None: The username if login is successful, None otherwise.

source.server.handle_signup(client_socket)[source]¶

Handle the user registration process for a client.

Args:

client_socket (socket.socket): The client’s socket.

Returns:

str or None: The username if registration is successful, None otherwise.

source.server.is_user_banned(username)[source]¶

Check if a user is currently banned from the server.

Args:

username (str): The username to check.

Returns:

bool: True if the user is banned, False otherwise.

source.server.is_user_kicked(username)[source]¶

Check if a user is currently kicked from the server.

Args:

username (str): The username to check.

Returns:

bool: True if the user is kicked, False otherwise.

source.server.kick_user(target_user, duration)[source]¶

Kick a user from the server for a specified duration.

Args:

target_user (str): The username of the user to be kicked. duration (str): The duration of the kick in seconds.

Returns:

None

source.server.kill_server()[source]¶

Initiate a server shutdown process.

Sends a broadcast message to all clients, announces the server shutdown, and schedules the actual server shutdown after a 10-second delay.

Returns:

None

source.server.process_admin_command(admin_command)[source]¶

Process an admin command received from the admin console.

Args:

admin_command (str): The admin command to process.

Returns:

None

source.server.receive_message(sock)[source]¶

Receive a message from a specified socket.

Args:

sock (socket.socket): The socket from which to receive the message.

Returns:

bytes: The received message.

source.server.register_user(username, password, ip_address)[source]¶

Register a new user with the provided username, password, and IP address.

Args:

username (str): The username for the new user. password (str): The password for the new user. ip_address (str): The IP address of the new user.

Returns:

bool: True if registration is successful, False otherwise.

source.server.send_message(sock, message)[source]¶

Send a message to a specified socket.

Args:

sock (socket.socket): The socket to which the message will be sent. message (str): The message to send.

Returns:

None

source.server.send_private_message(sender, receiver, content)[source]¶

Send a private message to a specific user.

Args:

sender (str): The username of the message sender. receiver (str): The username of the message receiver. content (str): The content of the private message.

Returns:

None

source.server.shutdown_server()[source]¶

Perform the actual shutdown of the server.

Closes the server socket, disconnects from the database, and exits the application.

Returns:

None

source.server.store_message(sender, content, sender_ip)[source]¶

Store a public message in the database.

Args:

sender (str): The username of the message sender. content (str): The content of the message. sender_ip (str): The IP address of the message sender.

Returns:

None

source.server.store_private_message(sender, receiver, content, sender_ip)[source]¶

Store a private message in the database.

Args:

sender (str): The username of the message sender. receiver (str): The username of the message receiver. content (str): The content of the message. sender_ip (str): The IP address of the message sender.

Returns:

None

source.server.unban_user(target_user)[source]¶

Unban a user from the server.

Args:

target_user (str): The username of the user to be unbanned.

Returns:

None

source.server.update_user_ip(username, ip_address)[source]¶

Update the IP address associated with a given username.

Args:

username (str): The username for which to update the IP address. ip_address (str): The new IP address.

Returns:

None
